intro: Pilosella melanops, commonly known as the black-haired mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow daisy-like flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in grassy areas and open woodlands. Pilosella melanops typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. Its flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
